intro: Lychnophora arrojadoana, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to northeastern Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and red, fleshy fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks. It has aromatic leaves that are sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
